stream_context.summary: Kaze finishes the Course 1 re-work and shifts the stream to Course 14.  He fixes small visual bugs, shows Biobak’s new HUD font, and spends most of the session redesigning Course 14’s sixth star: replacing a stiff paper-airplane Silver-Star mission with a new, Wing-Cap-only free-flight challenge that uses rip-able paper targets mounted on bubble-blowers.  He live-prototypes a paper-airplane model, discusses performance optimizations, and coordinates asset work with Biobak, Badub, Zeina, and Lilaa.

development_findings.summary: Course 1’s visual and gameplay re-work is formally declared finished; development focus returns to Course 14.
development_findings.quote: Today actually we’re done with course one.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 contains multiple biomes and now has five distinct background tracks that cross-fade based on the player’s location, all composed by Badub.
development_findings.quote: This level has like five different songs that all play at different times depending on where you are.

development_findings.summary: The original Silver-Star paper-airplane mission felt too rigid, so it will be replaced with a Wing-Cap-only challenge available only in Act 5/6 to emphasize freedom and contrast.
development_findings.quote: What if there was a Wing Cap that only spawned during Act 6… suddenly the whole level opens up.

development_findings.summary: New objective concept: fly through paper targets (mounted in bubble-blower frames) that rip on contact; cannons provide momentum resets.
development_findings.quote: I think I like that, yeah.  That’s better than Silver Stars.

development_findings.summary: Paper airplane will stay but serve only as a shortcut or set-piece; a fresh low-poly model and graph-paper texture were created live on stream.
Performance concerns noted for Course 14 (overdraw, 5 k-triangle mountains); plan to cull hidden faces, cut floors, and sort materials—confidence it will hit real-hardware 50 FPS.
development_findings.quote: As I am actually… a little bit worried about the performance.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s new HUD font uses semi-transparent pixels, reducing pixelation and modernizing the UI.
development_findings.quote: If you look closely at the font now it’s much less pixelated.

development_findings.summary: Fixed mis-rotating mushroom caps and updated crouch / grind animation; Zeina will supply a proper HUD icon later.
Identified a camera auto-rotate bug that disables itself during flight; marked for debugging.
development_findings.quote: This camera is totally wrong… it just keeps turning auto-rotate off.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values ‘contrast’ to heighten player emotion; limiting freedom early and unleashing it with the Wing Cap is a deliberate design philosophy.
context_findings.quote: By having a strong contrast between non-free and free parts, the freedom is going to feel more freedom.

context_findings.summary: He self-assesses as stronger coder than designer (‘7/10’) and is comfortable reworking levels multiple times to avoid mediocrity.
context_findings.quote: Just because I say things doesn’t mean they’re necessarily true … as a designer I’m like 7 out of 10.

context_findings.summary: Expresses playful hostility toward Nintendo takedowns and frustration with Game Freak’s unused model features, revealing a general mistrust of large IP holders.
context_findings.quote: Nintendo should be scared I attack headquarters.

biobak.summary: Authored the new HUD font with smoother anti-aliasing and transparent pixels.
Regularly re-works levels, somehow improving both visuals and performance each pass; slated to handle Course 14 terrain and possibly the bubble-blower target model.
biobak.quote: Somehow every time Biobak reworks the levels, he improves the performance despite adding a shit ton of stuff.

badub.summary: Delivered several new multi-layered tracks for Course 14 and uploads them quickly to SoundCloud.
badub.quote: Oh my god, Badub made so many new songs.

zeina.summary: Will create a finalized icon for the new crouch/grind HUD element; previously handled other animations.
zeina.quote: I already asked Zeina to make a new icon … the current icon is completely temporary.

key_stories.title: The Bridge That Didn’t Belong
key_stories.summary: While polishing Course 1, Kaze notices an old log-bridge texture that clashes with the surrounding art style.  He experiments live with gradients, RGB combiners, and alternative woods to find a better match.
key_stories.challenge: Existing bridge looked ‘unfitting’ and overly pixelated.
key_stories.process: Tried multiple textures, applied gradient via combiner, and previewed on CRT emulation.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on an improved texture but left door open for further tweaking.
key_stories.key_quote: The bridge is unfitting.  It doesn’t fit in the world that it’s in.

key_stories.title: Paper-Airplane Mission Pivot
key_stories.summary: The planned Silver-Star airplane ride felt dull, so Kaze brainstorms alternatives with chat.  They land on spawning a Wing Cap in later acts, letting players fly through rip-able paper targets for a timed star.
key_stories.challenge: Stiff, rails-based airplane sequence offered little freedom.
key_stories.process: Discussed wing/cloud cap, secret ground-pound spots, cannons, and finally paper targets mounted on bubble blowers.
key_stories.outcome: New mission spec accepted; asset list created and programming scheduled.
key_stories.key_quote: I’m sold on this idea.  We’re doing that.

key_stories.title: Origami by Calculator
key_stories.summary: Needing a proper paper-airplane prop, Kaze mathematically derives fold angles, models it in Blender, maps graph-paper textures, and finalizes a low-poly asset on stream.
key_stories.challenge: Community-provided models looked unrealistic; wanted authentic folds.
key_stories.process: Calculated 22.5° folds, mirrored UVs, added film-grain, adjusted color.
key_stories.outcome: Approved airplane model saved; handed to Biobak and Lilaa for in-game use.
key_stories.key_quote: Look at this beautiful fold.  It looks just like a real paper airplane now.

open_questions.context: Level has five tracks that cross-fade by region.

open_questions.context: Kaze flagged overdraw and large triangle counts but feels confident after culling.
